column4: linux-image-2.6-686 is a metapackage that always depends on the current real kernel package
I thought so, is it correct that I can select linux-image-2.6-686 for installation in aptitude even though linux-image-2.6.8.1-3-686 is installed already?
I guess having linux-image-2.6-686 installed just ensures I am kept up to date
